paper_title: The $L^p$-boundedness of wave operators for fourth order Schrödinger operators on ${\mathbb R}^4$
abstract: We prove that the wave operators of scattering theory for the fourth order Schrödinger operators $Δ^2 + V(x)$ in ${\mathbb R}^4$ are bounded in $L^p({\mathbb R}^4)$ for the set of $p$'s of $(1,\infty)$ depending on the kind of spectral singularities of $H$ at zero which can be described by the space of bounded solutions of $(Δ^2 + V(x))u(x)=0$.
